p: Due to its pro-health properties, eugenol is also used in the treatment of infections of the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tracts and is used for joint pain. It is also included in various medications intended for the inflammation of the mucosa in the upper respiratory tract and for the prevention of colds. These medications are commonly administered as inhalation and aerosol therapy: for example, Amol, Aromatol, or Olbas [ 32].
